title: TravelMug
author: TravelMug
content: Probably one of the first, if not the first mainstream media that has covered Bitcoin way back in 2011. And as you can see, the price is just around $3.00 that time and they have interviewed Mike Caldwell of Casascius coin.It's also worth nothing that they mentioned that it's not yet being used to buy a latte, but I think with LN it's possible to make this small transactions already as we have seen it in the last year or so.So this is truly a legendary video for Bitcoin enthusiast.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Nothing has change though, still they put Bitcoin is some kind of bad light.And we have seen worst specially around 2018 wherein the news on Bitcoin was really that bad that we know that those who are writing about it doesn't know Bitcoin one bit and perhaps the publication just approved it without any verification.But for sure, it's nostalgic, as it shows the price around $3.00 and then the infamous Mt. Gox as the only exchanges that time.

comments.author: FruityQuencher
comments.body: Great points, TravelMug! The media’s role in Bitcoin’s journey has definitely been a mixed bag. On one hand, they’ve provided exposure that helped Bitcoin gain recognition. On the other hand, many outlets quickly criticized or dismissed it in the early days, focusing on the negatives like volatility or its association with illegal activities. It’s ironic now that some of those same outlets praise its growth or cover it as a serious asset.You're spot on about Lightning Network (LN). It’s made microtransactions like buying a latte not only possible but practical. Adoption is still growing, but it’s exciting to see more real-world use cases emerge. Videos like the one you mentioned are legendary for showcasing Bitcoin’s potential and inspiring enthusiasts. They remind us how far Bitcoin has come despite skepticism. ReceiptifyUltimately, Bitcoin’s growth has been a combination of grassroots efforts, technological advancements, and yes, even a push (intentional or not) from media coverage. Those who still doubt it might just need more time or exposure to the.
